46   | /** not applicable **/

48   | /** ************************************************************************ **/
49   | /**				      MACROS				     **/
50   | /** ************************************************************************ **/
51   | 
52   | #define WHATIS_SOME	0
53   | #define WHATIS_ALL	1
54   | 
55   | /** ************************************************************************ **/
56   | /**				    LOCAL DATA				     **/
57   | /** ************************************************************************ **/
58   | 
59   | static	char	module_name[] = __FILE__;
60   | 
61   | #if WITH_DEBUGGING_MODULECMD
62   | static	char	_proc_ModuleCmd_Whatis[] = "ModuleCmd_Whatis";
63   | static	char	_proc_ModuleCmd_Apropos[] = "ModuleCmd_Apropos";
64   | #endif
65   | #if WITH_DEBUGGING_UTIL_1
66   | static	char	_proc_whatis_dir[] = "whatis_dir";
67   | #endif
68   | 
69   | /** ************************************************************************ **/
70   | /**				    PROTOTYPES				     **/
71   | /** ************************************************************************ **/
72   | 
73   | static	int	 whatis_dir( char*, int, char**, int);
74   | 
75   | /*++++
76   |  ** ** Function-Header ***************************************************** **
77   |  **									     **
78   |  **   Function:		ModuleCmd_Whatis				     **
79   |  **									     **
80   |  **   Description:	Display the passed modules 'whatis' information	     **
81   |  **									     **
82   |  **   First Edition:	1995/12/31					     **
83   |  **									     **
84   |  **   Parameters:	Tcl_Interp	*interp		Attached Tcl Interp. **
85   |  **			int		 argc		Number of arguments  **
86   |  **			char		*argv[]		Argument list	     **
87   |  **									     **
88   |  **   Result:		int	TCL_ERROR	Failure			     **
89   |  **				TCL_OK		Successful operation	     **
90   |  **									     **
91   |  **   Attached Globals:	g_flags		These are set up accordingly before  **
92   |  **					this function is called in order to  **
93   |  **					control everything		     **
94   |  **			g_current_module	The module which is handled  **
95   |  **						by the current command	     **
96   |  **									     **
97   |  ** ************************************************************************ **
98   |  ++++*/
99   | 
100  | int ModuleCmd_Whatis(	Tcl_Interp	*interp,
101  | 			int		 argc,
102  | 			char		*argv[])
103  | {
104  |     Tcl_Interp	*whatis_interp;
105  |     Tcl_DString	 cmdbuf;
106  |     int		 i, result = TCL_OK;
107  |     char	 modulefile[ MOD_BUFSIZE],
108  | 		 modulename[ MOD_BUFSIZE],
109  | 		*modpath,		/** Buffer for the contents of the   **/
110  | 					/** environment variable MODULEPATH  **/
111  | 		**wptr,
112  | 		*dirname;
113  | 
114  | #if WITH_DEBUGGING_MODULECMD
115  |     ErrorLogger( NO_ERR_START, LOC, _proc_ModuleCmd_Whatis, NULL);
116  | #endif
117  | 
118  |     /**
119  |      **	 Initialize the command buffer and set up the modules flag to
120  |      **	 'whatisonly'
121  |      **/
122  |     Tcl_DStringInit( &cmdbuf);
123  |     g_flags |= M_WHATIS;
124  | 
125  |     /**
126  |      **	 Handle each passed module file. Create a Tcl interpreter for each
127  |      **	 module file to be handled and initialize it with custom module commands
128  |      **/
129  | 
130  |     if ( argc) {
131  |     /**
132  |      **	 User provided a list of modules for ``whatis'' info
133  |      **/
134  | 	for(i=0; i<argc && argv[i]; i++) {
135  | 
136  | 	    whatis_interp = Tcl_CreateInterp();
137  | 	    if( TCL_OK != (result = InitializeModuleCommands( whatis_interp))) {
138  | 		Tcl_DeleteInterp( whatis_interp);
139  | 		result = TCL_ERROR;
140  | 		break;
141  | 	    }
142  | 
143  | 	    /**
144  | 	     **	 locate the filename related to the passed module
145  | 	     **/
146  | 	    if( TCL_ERROR ==
147  | 		Locate_ModuleFile(whatis_interp,argv[i],modulename,modulefile)){
148  | 		Tcl_DeleteInterp( whatis_interp);
149  | 		if( OK != ErrorLogger( ERR_LOCATE, LOC, argv[i], NULL))
150  | 		    break;
151  | 		else
152  | 		    continue;
153  | 	    }
154  | 
155  | 	    /**
156  | 	     **	 Print out everything that would happen if the module file were
157  | 	     **	 executed ...
158  | 	     **/
159  | 	    g_current_module = modulename;
160  | 
161  | 	    cmdModuleWhatisInit();
162  | 	    result = CallModuleProcedure( whatis_interp, &cmdbuf, modulefile,
163  | 		"ModulesWhatis", 0);
164  | 
165  | 	    /**
166  | 	     **	 Print the result ...
167  | 	     **/
168  | 	    if( whatis) {
169  | 		wptr = whatis;
170  | 		while( *wptr)
171  | 		    fprintf( stderr, "%-21s: %s\n", argv[i], *wptr++);
172  | 	    }
173  | 
174  | 	    /**
175  | 	     **	 Remove the Tcl interpreter that has been used for printing ...
176  | 	     **/
177  | 	    Tcl_DeleteInterp( whatis_interp);
178  | 	    cmdModuleWhatisShut();
179  | 
180  | 	} /** for **/
181  |     } else {
182  |        /**
183  | 	**  User wants all module ``whatis'' info
184  | 	**/
185  | 
186  | 	/**
187  | 	 **  If no MODULEPATH defined, we can not output anything
188  | 	 **/
189  | 	if( !(modpath = (char *) xgetenv( "MODULEPATH")))
190  | 	    if( OK != ErrorLogger( ERR_MODULE_PATH, LOC, NULL))
191  | 		goto unwind0;
192  | 
193  | 	/**
194  | 	 **  Scan all the files
195  | 	 **/
196  | 	     /**
197  | 	      **  Tokenize the module path string and check all dirs
198  | 	      **/
199  | 	     for( dirname = xstrtok( modpath, ":");
200  | 		  dirname;
201  | 		  dirname = xstrtok( NULL, ":") ) {
202  | 	
203  | 		 if( !check_dir( dirname))
204  | 		     continue;
205  | 	
206  | 		 whatis_dir( dirname, argc, argv, WHATIS_ALL);
207  | 
208  | 	     } /** for **/
209  |     }
210  | 
211  |     /**
212  |      **	 Leave the 'whatis only mode', free up what has been used and return
213  |      **/
214  |     g_flags &= ~M_WHATIS;
215  |     fprintf( stderr, "\n");
216  | 
217  |     Tcl_DStringFree( &cmdbuf);
218  | 
219  |     /**
220  |      **	 Free up allocated resources
221  |      **/
222  |     null_free((void *) &modpath);
223  | 
224  |     /**
225  |      **	 Return on success
226  |      **/
227  | 
228  | #if WITH_DEBUGGING_MODULECMD
229  |     ErrorLogger( NO_ERR_END, LOC, _proc_ModuleCmd_Whatis, NULL);
230  | #endif
231  | 
232  |     return( result);			/** --- EXIT PROCEDURE (result)  --> **/
233  | 
234  | unwind1:
235  |     null_free((void *) &modpath);
236  | unwind0:
237  |     return( TCL_ERROR);			/** --- EXIT PROCEDURE (FAILURE) --> **/
238  | 
239  | } /** End of 'ModuleCmd_Whatis' **/
240  | 
241  | /*++++
242  |  ** ** Function-Header ***************************************************** **
243  |  **									     **
244  |  **   Function:		ModuleCmd_Apropos				     **
245  |  **									     **
246  |  **   Description:	Scan the whatis database in order to find something  **
247  |  **			matching the passed strings			     **
248  |  **									     **
249  |  **   First Edition:	1995/12/31					     **
250  |  **									     **
251  |  **   Parameters:	Tcl_Interp	*interp		Attached Tcl Interp. **
252  |  **			int		 argc		Number of arguments  **
253  |  **			char		*argv[]		Argument list	     **
254  |  **									     **
255  |  **   Result:		int	TCL_ERROR	Failure			     **
256  |  **				TCL_OK		Successful operation	     **
257  |  **									     **
258  |  **   Attached Globals:							     **
259  |  **									     **
260  |  ** ************************************************************************ **
261  |  ++++*/
262  | 
263  | int ModuleCmd_Apropos(	Tcl_Interp	*interp,
264  | 			int		 argc,
265  | 			char		*argv[])
266  | {
267  |     char	*dirname;
268  |     char	*modpath;		/** Buffer for the contents of the   **/
269  | 					/** environment variable MODULEPATH  **/
270  |     int		 i;
271  |     char	*c;
272  | 
273  | #if WITH_DEBUGGING_MODULECMD
274  |     ErrorLogger( NO_ERR_START, LOC, _proc_ModuleCmd_Apropos, NULL);
275  | #endif
276  | 
277  |     /**
278  |      **	 Ignore case ... convert all arguments to lower case
279  |      **/
280  |     if( sw_icase)
281  | 	for( i=0; i<argc; i++)
282  | 	    for( c=argv[ i]; c && *c; c++)
283  | 		*c = tolower( *c);
284  | 
285  |     /**
286  |      **	 If there's no MODULEPATH defined, we cannot output anything
287  |      **/
288  |     if((char *) NULL == (modpath =  xgetenv( "MODULEPATH")))
289  | 	if( OK != ErrorLogger( ERR_MODULE_PATH, LOC, NULL))
290  | 	    goto unwind0;
291  | 
292  | 	/**
293  | 	 **  Tokenize the module path string and check all dirs
294  | 	 **/
295  | 	for( dirname = xstrtok( modpath, ":");
296  | 	     dirname;
297  | 	     dirname = xstrtok( NULL, ":") ) {
298  | 	
299  | 	    if( !check_dir( dirname))
300  | 		continue;
301  | 	
302  | 	    whatis_dir( dirname, argc, argv, WHATIS_SOME);
303  | 
304  | 	} /** for **/
305  | 
306  |     /**
307  |      **	 Free up what has been allocated and exit from this procedure
308  |      **/
309  |     null_free((void *) &modpath);
310  | 
311  | #if WITH_DEBUGGING_MODULECMD
312  |     ErrorLogger( NO_ERR_END, LOC, _proc_ModuleCmd_Apropos, NULL);
313  | #endif
314  | 
315  |     return( TCL_OK);
316  | 
317  | unwind1:
318  |     null_free((void *) &modpath);
319  | unwind0:
320  |     return( TCL_ERROR);				/** ---- EXIT (FAILURE) ---> **/
321  | 
322  | } /** End of 'ModuleCmd_Apropos' **/
323  | 
324  | /*++++
325  |  ** ** Function-Header ***************************************************** **
326  |  **									     **
327  |  **   Function:		whatis_dir					     **
328  |  **									     **
329  |  **   Description:	Print all files beyond the passed directory	     **
330  |  **									     **
331  |  **   First Edition:	1991/10/23					     **
332  |  **									     **
333  |  **   Parameters:	char	*dir		Directory to be scanned	     **
334  |  **			int	 argc		Number of tokens	     **
335  |  **			char   **argv		List of tokens to check	     **
336  |  **									     **
337  |  **   Result:		int	TCL_OK		Successful operation	     **
338  |  **									     **
339  |  **   Attached Globals:	g_flags		These are set up accordingly before  **
340  |  **					this function is called in order to  **
341  |  **					control everything		     **
342  |  **			g_current_module	The module which is handled  **
343  |  **						by the current command	     **
344  |  **									     **
345  |  ** ************************************************************************ **
346  |  ++++*/
347  | 
348  | static	int	whatis_dir( char *dir, int argc, char **argv,
349  | 			    int whatis_list)
350  | {
351  |     fi_ent	 *dirlst_head = NULL;	/** Directory list base pointer	     **/
352  |     int		  count = 0;		/** Number of elements in the top    **/
353  | 					/** level directory list	     **/
354  |     int		  tcount = 0;		/** Total number of files to print   **/
355  |     char	**list;			/** flat list of module files	     **/
356  |     int		  start = 0, i, k;
357  |     int		  result = TCL_OK;
358  |     Tcl_Interp	 *whatis_interp;
359  |     Tcl_DString	  cmdbuf;
360  |     char	  modulefile[ MOD_BUFSIZE];
361  |     char	**wptr, *c;
362  |     struct stat	 stats;
363  | 
364  | #if WITH_DEBUGGING_UTIL_1
365  |     ErrorLogger( NO_ERR_START, LOC, _proc_whatis_dir, "dir='", dir, NULL);
366  | #endif
367  | 
368  |     /**
369  |      **	 Normal reading of the files
370  |      **/
371  | 
372  |     if( NULL == (dirlst_head = get_dir( dir, NULL, &count, &tcount)))
373  | 	if( OK != ErrorLogger( ERR_READDIR, LOC, dir, NULL))
374  | 	    goto unwind0;
375  | 
376  |     if( NULL == (list = (char**) module_malloc( tcount * sizeof( char**))))
377  | 	if( OK != ErrorLogger( ERR_ALLOC, LOC, NULL))
378  | 	    goto unwind1;
379  | 
380  |     dirlst_to_list( list, dirlst_head, count, &start, NULL, NULL);
381  | 
382  |     /**
383  |      **	 Initialize the command buffer and set up the modules flag to 'whatislay
384  |      **	 only'
385  |      **/
386  | 
387  |     Tcl_DStringInit( &cmdbuf);
388  |     g_flags |= M_WHATIS;
389  | 
390  |     /**
391  |      **	 Check all the files in the flat list for the passed tokens
392  |      **/
393  | 
394  |     for( i=0; i<tcount; i++) {
395  | 
396  | 	whatis_interp = Tcl_CreateInterp();
397  | 	if( TCL_OK != (result = InitializeModuleCommands( whatis_interp))) {
398  | 	    Tcl_DeleteInterp( whatis_interp);
399  | 	    result = TCL_ERROR;
400  | 	    break; /** for( i) **/
401  | 	}
402  | 
403  | 	/**
404  | 	 **  locate the filename related to the passed module
405  | 	 **/
406  | 
407  | 	if( (char *) NULL == stringer(modulefile,MOD_BUFSIZE,
408  | 		dir,"/",list[i],NULL)) {
409  | 	    result = TCL_ERROR;
410  | 	    break; /** for( i) **/
411  | 	}
412  | 	g_current_module = list[ i];
413  | 
414  | 	if( stat( modulefile, &stats) || S_ISDIR( stats.st_mode))
415  | 	    continue;
416  | 
417  | 	cmdModuleWhatisInit();
418  | 	result = CallModuleProcedure( whatis_interp, &cmdbuf, modulefile,
419  | 	    "ModulesApropos", 0);
420  | 
421  | 	/**
422  | 	 **  Check if at least one of the passed tokens is found in the
423  | 	 **  retrieved whatis strings. If yes, print the string.
424  | 	 **/
425  | 
426  | 	if( whatis) {
427  | 	    wptr = whatis;
428  | 	    while( *wptr) {
429  | 
430  | 		/**
431  | 		 **  Ignore case?
432  | 		 **/
433  | 
434  | 		if( sw_icase) {
435  | 		    strncpy( modulefile, *wptr, MOD_BUFSIZE);
436  | 		    for( c = modulefile; c && *c; c++)
437  | 			*c = tolower( *c);
438  | 		    c = modulefile;
439  | 		} else
440  | 		    c = *wptr;
441  | 
442  | 		/**
443  | 		 **  Seek for the passed tokens
444  | 		 **/
445  | 
446  | 		if( whatis_list)
447  | 		    fprintf( stderr, "%-21s: %s\n", list[i], *wptr);
448  | 		else
449  | 		    for( k=0; k<argc; k++) {
450  | 			if( strstr( c, argv[ k]))
451  | 		    	    fprintf( stderr, "%-21s: %s\n", list[i], *wptr);
452  | 		    }
453  | 		wptr++;
454  | 	    }
455  | 	}
456  | 
457  | 	/**
458  | 	 **  Remove the Tcl interpreter that has been used for printing ...
459  | 	 **/
460  | 
461  | 	Tcl_DeleteInterp( whatis_interp);
462  | 	cmdModuleWhatisShut();
463  | 
464  |     } /** for( i) **/
465  | 
466  |     /**
467  |      **	 Cleanup
468  |      **/
469  |     g_flags &= ~M_WHATIS;
470  |     delete_dirlst( dirlst_head, count);
471  |     delete_cache_list( list, start);
472  | 
473  | #if WITH_DEBUGGING_UTIL_1
474  |     ErrorLogger( NO_ERR_END, LOC, _proc_whatis_dir, NULL);
475  | #endif
476  | 
477  |     return( result);			/** ------- EXIT (result) --------> **/
478  | 
479  | unwind2:
480  |     delete_cache_list( list, start);
481  | unwind1:
482  |     delete_dirlst( dirlst_head, count);
483  | unwind0:
484  |     return( TCL_ERROR);			/** ------- EXIT (FAILURE) --------> **/
485  | 
486  | } /** End of 'whatis_dir' **/
